China Tak Akan Menoleransi Perbedaan Pendapat di Hong Kong
01 Nov 2019, 15:57 by Novi Christiastuti
Hong Kong - Pemerintah China memperingatkan tidak akan menoleransi setiap perbedaan pendapat dan tantangan terhadap sistem pemerintahan di Hong Kong. China disebut tengah menyusun langkah untuk meningkatkan patriotisme di kota semi-otonomi tersebut.
Seperti dilansir AFP, Jumat (1/11/2019), Direktur Komisi Urusan Hong Kong, Macau dan Hukum Dasar, Shen Chunyao, menyebut bentrokan yang terjadi di Hong Kong, yang merupakan Wilayah Administrasi Khusus, menjadi topik penting dalam rapat besar Partai Komunis China yang dipimpin Presiden Xi Jinping pekan ini.
Pemerintah pusat China sejauh ini menyuarakan keyakinan bahwa pemimpin eksekutif Hong Kong, Carrie Lam, dan Kepolisian Hong Kong akan mampu meredakan unjuk rasa sarat kekerasan yang masih marak di kota tersebut.
Namun seluruh perhatian fokus pada apakah kepemimpinan Partai Komunis China akan lebih menancapkan kendali atas situasi di Hong Kong jika unjuk rasa semakin tak terkendali. Unjuk rasa di Hong Kong terus berlanjut sejak dimulai lima bulan lalu.
Dituturkan Shen dalam pernyataannya bahwa para pemimpin Partai Komunis China sepakat untuk 'meningkatkan lebih jauh sistem kepemimpinan pemerintah pusat atas wilayah' Hong Kong dan menjaga 'kemakmuran dan stabilitas jangka panjang'.
"(China) Tidak akan pernah menoleransi setiap tindakan yang menantang dasar dari 'satu negara, dua sistem', tidak akan pernah menoleransi setiap tindakan yang memisahkan negara dan membahayakan keamanan nasional dan dengan tegas mencegah dan menangkal campur tangan kekuatan asing dalam urusan Hong Kong dan Macau," tegas Shen.

China Will Not Tolerate Opinion Differences in Hong Kong
Nov 01 2019, 15:57 by Novi Christiastuti
Hong Kong - The Chinese government has warned it will not tolerate any dissent and challenges to the government system in Hong Kong. China is said to be working on steps to increase patriotism in the semi-autonomous city.
As reported by AFP on Friday (1/11/2019), Director of the Hong Kong, Macau and Basic Law Commission, Shen Chunyao, said the clashes that took place in Hong Kong, which is a Special Administrative Region, became an important topic at a large meeting of the Chinese Communist Party led by President Xi Jinping this week.
The Chinese central government has so far voiced confidence that Hong Kong's chief executive, Carrie Lam and the Hong Kong Police will be able to defuse violent demonstrations that are still rife in the city.
But all attention focused on whether the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party would have more control over the situation in Hong Kong if the demonstrations were increasingly out of control. Demonstrations in Hong Kong have continued since it began five months ago.
Shen said in his statement that the leaders of the Chinese Communist Party agreed to "further enhance the central government's leadership system over the" Hong Kong region and maintain "long-term prosperity and stability".
"(China) Will never tolerate any action that challenges the basis of 'one country, two systems', will never tolerate any act that separates the country and endangers national security and firmly prevents and repels the interference of foreign powers in Hong Kong affairs and Macau, "Shen stated.
